revised_title: Adjusting the Fixed Points of Thermometers and Precautions in Using Thermometer Instruments
tldr: The committee appointed by the Royal Society investigates the best method for adjusting the fixed points of thermometers and the precautions necessary when using them. They discuss the effects of barometer height, water depth, and steam exposure on the accuracy of temperature measurements and propose a method to improve the consistency of boiling point adjustments.
